histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.InitSequence
histogram.summary: Logged during StructuredMetricsService initialization whether the init task or the initial log timer completed first. The expectation is the vast majority of the time, the init task should complete first. If metrics show otherwise, then it may indicate there's a bug in the StructuredMetricsService init sequence and that it should be investigated.

histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.LogStore.CompressionRatio
histogram.summary: The compression ratio of Structured Metrics logs. Recorded when logs are stored.

histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.LogStore.Dropped
histogram.summary: The number of logs dropped for exceeding the log size constraints. Recorded when trimming the logs is complete and when the remaining logs is less then the original logs.

histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.LogStore.DroppedSize
histogram.summary: The size in KB of logs trimmed by log storage for being too large. Recorded when trimming the log and the compressed size of a log exceeds the max log size.

histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.Reporting.ActualUploadInterval
histogram.summary: The actual interval between log upload start and previous log upload finished within the same process. A value of 0 indicates there was no previous upload.

histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.Reporting.HTTPErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP and network errors encountered by Structured Metrics when attempting to upload logs to the server through an HTTPS connection.

histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.Reporting.HTTPResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes encountered by Structured Metrics when attempting to upload logs to the server through an HTTPS connection.

histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.Reporting.LogSize.OnSuccess
histogram.summary: Size in kilobytes (after compression) of an uploaded Structured Metrics log. Recorded after a successful Structured Metrics upload.

histogram.name: StructuredMetrics.Reporting.LogSize.RejectedSize
histogram.summary: Size in kilobytes (after compression) of a log rejected for being to large.
